content.text: is designed to compile meter transaction data into a specific format, referred to as "EC3 transaction records." It processes data from various tables related to meter readings and billing adjustments, updates records, and handles transactions within the
schema. The procedure includes error handling to manage exceptions and ensure data integrity.
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to several factors:
It involves multiple SQL operations, including
It includes error handling with detailed logging and error raising.
The procedure interacts with multiple tables and requires understanding of the underlying data model.
: Represents the billing period for which transactions are being processed. It is used in conditional logic to determine billing status updates.
: An identifier for the authenticated user or process executing the procedure. It is not directly used within the procedure's logic.
: An output parameter used to indicate the success or failure of the procedure. It is set to
: Declares local variables and sets up a carriage return/line feed string for error messages.
to ensure all operations are atomic.
. This involves complex logic to select the latest meter details and aggregate transaction data.
with account and meter sequence IDs from related tables.
Updates unique sequence IDs for accounts and meters.
Updates billing adjustment records with data from
: Updates the billing status fields based on conditions involving the billing period and existing data.
block to handle exceptions. If an error occurs, it logs detailed information and rolls back the transaction.
: Commits the transaction if no errors occur.
table can be efficient but cause issues if the table is large or frequently accessed.
: The use of complex joins and subqueries can impact performance, especially if the tables involved are large or lack proper indexing.
: The transaction encompasses multiple operations, which can lock resources and affect concurrency. Consider optimizing the transaction scope to minimize locking.
: The detailed error handling logic adds overhead but is necessary for robust error management.
: Truncating tables and performing bulk inserts/updates can lead to data integrity issues if not carefully managed.
: The procedure's transaction management may lead to locking and blocking issues, affecting other processes accessing the same tables.
: While comprehensive, the error handling logic may not cover all edge cases, potentially leading to unhandled exceptions.
: As data volume grows, the performance of complex joins and subqueries may degrade, necessitating optimization or refactoring.
: The procedure relies on several external tables and their structures, which may change over time, leading to potential maintenance challenges.

CREATE PROCEDURE [CrisNationalGridWest].[usp_CRIS_ProcessMeterCompileTransactions]
	@BillingPeriod varchar(6),
	@authenticatedID int,
	@StatusCode int  OUTPUT      
   
 AS 
 BEGIN
		--********************************************************************************
		--	Author: MOHAMMED BELARREM
		--	Description: Compile transactions into ec3 format 
		--
		--	Log: 
		--	06/03/2010	MOH Creation:
		--	06/15/2010	MOH	update:	Added therms, thermsfactor and GasRateCode
		--	07/09/2010	MOH	Update:	Added CurrentMeterNumber
		--	07/12/2010	MOH	Update:	Added logic to handle the roll over meters 
		--	07/21/2010	MOH	Update:	Changed the way I calculate the LatestMeterDetails table to go by CurrentMeterNumber
		--	07/23/2010	MOH	Update:	Corrected the update to the adjustment table that puts in the Account and meter seqids 
		--	07/29/2010	MOH	Update:	Corrected the query that figures out which meters are adjustments and which are inserts
		--  09/23/2010  MOH Update: Corrected the query to create the adjustment records to go by BillingTransactionCode and ActivityDateTime 
		--							since ActivityDateTime was not unique 
		--  01/11/2010  MOH Update: Added the condition to test and pickup only non excluded transaction 
		--  12/11/2018  VY  update: for UniqueAccountSeqID and for UniqueMeterSeqID
		--  12/28/2018  VY  update: modified to use UniqueSeqIDs 
		--********************************************************************************
	 
		--********************************************************************************
		DECLARE @AccountNumber acctnum
		DECLARE @MeterNumber MeterNumber

		declare @crlf varchar(2)
		set @crlf = CHAR(13) + CHAR(10) 

	
			
		begin try	
		
				begin TRANSACTION CompileTransactions 
				set @StatusCode  = 0
				--
				truncate table [CrisNationalGridWest].[UploadMeterBillingAdjustment]
				--
				
				-- combine information from the transaction table and the uploadMeterDetail to construct EC3 transaction records
				-- the join grabs only the latest meter read detail, since it should have the latest and greatest 
				
				INSERT INTO [CrisNationalGridWest].[UploadMeterBillingAdjustment]
						   ([UtilityCompanySeqid]
						   ,[AccountInvoiceBillingGroup]
						   ,AccountSeqid
						   ,UniqueAccountSeqid /* added 12/11/2018 */
						   ,MeterSeqid
						   ,UniqueMeterSeqid /* added 12/11/2018 */
						   ,AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid
						   ,NumberOfTransactions
						   ,NumberOfRebillTransactions
						   ,NumberOfCancelTransactions
						   ,[BillingPeriod]
						   ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
						   ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
						   ,[MeterReadWorkDay]
						   ,[UtilityServiceAccountName]
						   ,[UtilityServiceAddress]
						   ,[Borough]
						   ,[Zipcode]
						   ,[State]
						   ,[SpecialLedgerAccountNumber]
						   ,[MeterNumber]
						   ,[CurrentMeterNumber]
						   ,[MeterConstant]
						   ,[NumberOfDials]
						   ,[EstimatedOrActual]
						   ,[MeterType]
						   ,[FromDate]
						   ,[ToDate]
						   ,BillingPeriodDays
						   ,[MeterFromReading]
						   ,[MeterToReading]
						   ,[MeterCCF]
						   ,Therms
						   ,ThermsFactor
						   ,GasRateCode
						   ,HasMeterRolledOver
						   ,[FixFactor]
						   ,[PartSupplied]
						   ,[MeterBillingStatus]
						   ,[PreviousMeterBillingStatus]
						   ,[MeterBillingStatusCodePeriod]
						   ,DerivedFromSpannedBill
						   ,[SpannedMeterCCF]
						   ,SpannedTherms
						   ,SpannedThermsFactor
						   ,[SpannedFromDate]
						   ,[SpannedToDate]
						   ,[SpannedMeterReadingFrom]
						   ,[SpannedMeterReadingTo]
						   ,[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
						   ,[SpannedTotalPercentage]
						   ,[HasReportedCancel]
						   ,[CancelSpecialLedgerAccountNumber]
						   ,[CancelMeterNumber]
						   ,[CancelMeterConstant]
						   ,[CancelNumberOfDials]
						   ,[CancelEstimatedOrActual]
						   ,[CancelMeterType]
						   ,[CancelFromDate]
						   ,[CancelToDate]
						   ,[CancelMeterFromReading]
						   ,[CancelMeterToReading]
						   ,[CancelMeterCCF]
						   ,[CancelTherms]
						   ,[CancelThermsFactor]
						   ,[CancelFixFactor]
						   ,[CancelPartSupplied]
						   ,EnergySource
						   ,MeterReset
						   ,[Notes])
					 
				SELECT
						    UtilityCompanySeqid											--- [UtilityCompanySeqid]
						   ,AccountInvoiceBillingGroup									--- [AccountInvoiceBillingGroup]
						   ,NULL														--- AccountSeqid
						   ,NULL                                                        --- UniqueAccountSeqid /* added 12/11/2018 */
						   ,NULL														--- MeterSeqid
						   ,NULL                                                        --- UniqueMeterSeqid /* added 12/11/2018 */
						   ,NULL														--- AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid
						   ,NumberOfRebillTransactions + NumberOfCancelTransactions		--- NumberOfTransactions
						   ,NumberOfRebillTransactions									--- NumberOfRebillTransactions
						   ,NumberOfCancelTransactions									--- NumberOfCancelTransactions
						   ,BillingPeriod												--- [BillingPeriod]
						   ,GroupedTransactions.BillingPeriodRevision					--- [BillingPeriodRevision]
						   ,AccountNumber												--- [OriginalAccountNumber]
						   ,MeterReadWorkDay											--- [MeterReadWorkDay]
						   ,UtilityServiceAccountName                   				--- [UtilityServiceAccountName]
						   ,UtilityServiceAddress                       				--- [UtilityServiceAddress]
						   ,Borough                                     				--- [Borough]
						   ,Zipcode                                     				--- [Zipcode]
						   ,State														--- [State]
						   ,SpecialLedgerAccountNumber									--- [SpecialLedgerAccountNumber]
						   ,LatestMeterDetails.MeterNumber              				--- [MeterNumber]   -- since we are grabbing the latest transaction, this might be the CurrentAccountNumber all the time
						   ,LatestMeterDetails.CurrentMeterNumber          				--- [CurrentMeterNumber]
						   ,MeterConstant                               				--- [MeterConstant]
						   ,NumberOfDials                               				--- [NumberOfDials]
						   ,GroupedTransactions.EstimatedOrActual						--- [EstimatedOrActual]
						   ,MeterType                                   				--- [MeterType]
						   ,FromDate                                    				--- [FromDate]
						   ,ToDate                                      				--- [ToDate]
						   ,dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(FromDate, ToDate)			--- BillingPeriodDays
						   ,GroupedTransactions.MeterFromReading						--- [MeterFromReading]
						   ,GroupedTransactions.MeterToReading							--- [MeterToReading]
						   ,GroupedTransactions.MeterCCF								--- [MeterCCF]
						   ,GroupedTransactions.Therms									--- Therms
						   ,GroupedTransactions.ThermsFactor							--- ThermsFactor
						   ,LatestMeterDetails.GasRateCode								--- GasRateCode	
						   ,GroupedTransactions.HasMeterRolledOver						--- HasMeterRolledOver		 
						   ,FixFactor                                   				--- [FixFactor]
						   ,PartSupplied                                				--- [PartSupplied]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [MeterBillingStatus]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [PreviousMeterBillingStatus]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [MeterBillingStatusCodePeriod]
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN 'Y'								 ELSE 'N'  END   --- DerivedFromSpannedBill
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN LatestMeterDetails.MeterCCF		 ELSE NULL END   --- [SpannedMeterCCF]
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN LatestMeterDetails.Therms			 ELSE NULL END   --- [Spannedtherms]
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN LatestMeterDetails.ThermsFactor	 ELSE NULL END   --- [SpannedThermsFactor]
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN MeterReadingFromDate				 ELSE NULL END   --- [SpannedFromDate]
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN MeterReadingToDate					 ELSE NULL END   --- [SpannedToDate]
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN LatestMeterDetails.MeterFromReading ELSE NULL END   --- [SpannedMeterReadingFrom]
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN LatestMeterDetails.MeterToReading	 ELSE NULL END   --- [SpannedMeterReadingTo]
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN SpannedMonthlyPercentage			 ELSE NULL END   --- [SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
						   ,CASE WHEN CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision <> FirstBillingPeriodCanceled THEN SpannedTotalPercentage				 ELSE NULL END   --- [SpannedTotalPercentage]
						   ,GroupedTransactions.HasReportedCancel						--- HasReportedCancel
						   ,NULL 														--- [CancelSpecialLedgerAccountNumber]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelMeterNumber]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelMeterConstant]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelNumberOfDials]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelEstimatedOrActual]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelMeterType]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelFromDate]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelToDate]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelMeterFromReading]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelMeterToReading]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelMeterCCF]
						   ,null														--- [CancelTherms]
						   ,null														--- [CancelThermsFactor]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelFixFactor]
						   ,NULL                                        				--- [CancelPartSupplied]
						   ,5     														--- EnergySource
						   ,LatestMeterDetails.HasMeterRolledOver						--- MeterReset
						   ,NULL														--- [Notes]
						   
				FROM (
							-- corrected MOH 20100923 to go by BillingTransactionCode and ActivityDateTime since ActivityDateTime was not unique 
							SELECT * FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail
							WHERE UploadMeterReadDetailSeqid = (  SELECT TOP 1 UploadMeterReadDetailSeqid FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail AS MeterReadDetail
																  WHERE MeterReadDetail.AccountNumber = UploadMeterReadDetail.AccountNumber AND MeterReadDetail.CurrentMeterNumber = UploadMeterReadDetail.CurrentMeterNumber AND MeterReadDetail.ExcludeTest = 'N' AND MeterReadDetail.IsProcessed ='N' AND MeterReadDetail.BillingTransactionCode = 'BI'
																  ORDER BY BillingTransactionCode DESC, ActivityDateTime DESC)
						) AS LatestMeterDetails
						INNER JOIN 
						(
							SELECT 
								   [BillingPeriodRevision]
								  ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
								  ,[CurrentMeterNumber]
								  ,SUM(CAST((CASE WHEN isCancel = 'Y' THEN 0 ELSE 1 END) AS int)) AS NumberOfCancelTransactions
								  ,SUM(CAST((CASE WHEN isCancel = 'N' THEN 0 ELSE 1 END) AS int)) AS NumberOfRebillTransactions
								  ,MIN([EstimatedOrActual]) AS EstimatedOrActual
								  ,MIN([FromDate]) AS FromDate
								  ,MAX([ToDate]) AS ToDate
								  ,MIN([MeterFromReading]) AS MeterFromReading
								  ,CASE WHEN (MAX(HasMeterRolledOver) = 'Y' ) THEN MIN([MeterToReading])  ELSE  MAX([MeterToReading]) END AS MeterToReading
								  ,SUM([MeterCCF]) AS MeterCCF
								  ,SUM([Therms]) AS Therms
								  ,MAX([ThermsFactor]) AS ThermsFactor
								  ,MAX([SpannedMonthlyPercentage]) AS SpannedMonthlyPercentage
								  ,MAX([SpannedTotalPercentage]) AS SpannedTotalPercentage
								  ,MAX(HasMeterRolledOver) AS HasMeterRolledOver
								  ,MAX(IsCancel) AS HasReportedCancel
							FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingCRISTransaction 
							WHERE CurrentMeterNumber IS NOT NULL
							GROUP BY OriginalAccountNumber, CurrentMeterNumber, BillingPeriodRevision
							
						) AS GroupedTransactions
						ON LatestMeterDetails.CurrentMeterNumber = GroupedTransactions.CurrentMeterNumber
						AND LatestMeterDetails.AccountNumber = GroupedTransactions.OriginalAccountNumber 
												
						
				UPDATE	CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment
				SET		 AccountSeqid					= OriginalAccountSeqid
						,MeterSeqid						= OriginalMeterSeqid
						,AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid = Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid
				FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment
				INNER JOIN Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack 
				ON CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalAccountNumber
				AND CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.CurrentMeterNumber = Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalMeterNumber

				-- added 12/12/2018 update unique account seqid information
				UPDATE	CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment
				SET CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.UniqueAccountSeqID = Billing.Account.UniqueAccountSeqid
				FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment INNER JOIN Billing.Account ON CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.AccountSeqid = Billing.Account.AccountSeqID
				WHERE CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.UniqueAccountSeqID is null

				-- added 12/12/2018 update unique meter seqid information
				UPDATE	CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment
				SET CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.UniqueMeterSeqID = Billing.Meter.UniqueMeterSeqid
				FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment INNER JOIN Billing.Meter ON CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.MeterSeqID = Billing.Meter.MeterSeqID
				WHERE CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.UniqueMeterSeqID is null
				
				-- update with information form EC3
				
				-- update from the MeterBillingCrisGas
				UPDATE CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment
				SET	   	MeterBillingSeqid					= MeterBillingCrisGas.MeterBillingSeqid
					   ,MeterBillingCrisGasSeqid			= MeterBillingCrisGas.MeterBillingCrisGasSeqid
					   ,[CancelSpecialLedgerAccountNumber]	= MeterBillingCrisGas.SpecialLedgerAccountNumber
					   ,[CancelMeterNumber]					= MeterBillingCrisGas.MeterNumber 
					   ,[CancelMeterConstant]				= MeterBillingCrisGas.MeterConstant		
					   ,[CancelNumberOfDials]				= MeterBillingCrisGas.NumberOfDials
					   ,[CancelEstimatedOrActual]			= MeterBillingCrisGas.EstimatedOrActual
					   ,[CancelMeterType]					= MeterBillingCrisGas.MeterType
					   ,[CancelFromDate]					= MeterBillingCrisGas.FromDate
					   ,[CancelToDate]						= MeterBillingCrisGas.ToDate
					   ,[CancelMeterFromReading]			= MeterBillingCrisGas.MeterFromReading
					   ,[CancelMeterToReading]				= MeterBillingCrisGas.MeterToReading
					   ,[CancelMeterCCF]					= MeterBillingCrisGas.MeterCCF
					   ,[CancelTherms]						= MeterBillingCrisGas.Therms
					   ,[CancelThermsFactor]				= MeterBillingCrisGas.ThermsFactor
					   ,[CancelFixFactor]					= MeterBillingCrisGas.FixFactor
					   ,[CancelPartSupplied]				= MeterBillingCrisGas.PartSupplied
				
				FROM	Billing.MeterBillingCrisGas INNER JOIN Billing.Meter 
						ON	Billing.MeterBillingCrisGas.MeterSeqid = Billing.Meter.MeterSeqid 
						AND Billing.MeterBillingCrisGas.UniqueMeterSeqId = Billing.Meter.UniqueMeterSeqid /* added 12/12/2018 */
						INNER JOIN CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment 
						ON	Billing.Meter.CurrentMeterNumber = CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.CurrentMeterNumber AND 
							Billing.Meter.OriginalAccountNumber = CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
							Billing.MeterBillingCrisGas.BillingPeriodRevision = CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.BillingPeriodRevision

				
				-- update billing status
				UPDATE CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment                                                               
				SET	   	[MeterBillingStatus]				= CASE WHEN MeterBillingCrisGasSeqid IS NULL AND BillingPeriodRevision < @BillingPeriod THEN 'BA' ELSE MeterStatus end
					   ,[PreviousMeterBillingStatus]		= MeterPreviousStatus
					   ,[MeterBillingStatusCodePeriod]		= MeterStatusCodePeriod
				
				FROM	Billing.Meter 
						INNER JOIN CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment 
						ON	CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.MeterSeqid = Billing.Meter.MeterSeqid 
						AND CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterBillingAdjustment.UniqueMeterSeqid = Billing.Meter.UniqueMeterSeqid /* added 12/12/2018 */
								




				commit TRANSACTION CompileTransactions


		END TRY
		BEGIN CATCH
		
				DECLARE @CustomErrorMessage NVARCHAR(4000);
				DECLARE @ErrorMessage NVARCHAR(4000);
				DECLARE @ErrorSeverity INT;
				DECLARE @ErrorState INT;
				DECLARE @ErrorNumber INT;
				DECLARE @ErrorLine INT;
				DECLARE @ErrorProcedure NVARCHAR(126);
				--
				SELECT 
					@CustomErrorMessage ='Error in StoredProcedure %s at line number %d' + @crlf + 'Billing Period: %s' + @crlf + 'Account:Meter (%s : %s)  ' + @crlf,
					@ErrorMessage	= ERROR_MESSAGE(),
					@ErrorSeverity	= ERROR_SEVERITY(),
					@ErrorState		= ERROR_STATE(),
					@ErrorNumber	= ERROR_NUMBER(),
					@ErrorProcedure = ERROR_PROCEDURE(),
					@ErrorLine		= ERROR_LINE();			
				--
				set	@ErrorMessage = @CustomErrorMessage + @ErrorMessage + @crlf + 'ErrorNumber: ' + cast(@ErrorNumber as varchar(10)) + @crlf
				--
				RAISERROR (@ErrorMessage, -- Message text.
						   @ErrorSeverity, -- Severity.
						   @ErrorState, -- State.
						   @ErrorProcedure,
						   @ErrorLine,
						   @BillingPeriod,
						   @AccountNumber,
						   @MeterNumber
						   ) with log; 
				
				set @StatusCode  = 1
						   
				ROLLBACK TRANSACTION CompileTransactions	
						   
		END CATCH




	
 end
